comment: Smart Data Models - EquivalentBranch adapted to DTDL from smartdatamodels.org. Source: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/smart-data-models/dataModel.EnergyCIM/master/EquivalentBranch/schema.json
description: Adapted from CIM data models. The class represents equivalent branches.

contents.name: alternateName
contents.comment: An alternative name for this item

contents.name: areaServed
contents.comment: The geographic area where a service or offered item is provided

contents.name: dataProvider
contents.comment: A sequence of characters identifying the provider of the harmonised data entity.

contents.name: dateCreated
contents.comment: Entity creation timestamp. This will usually be allocated by the storage platform.

contents.name: dateModified
contents.comment: Timestamp of the last modification of the entity. This will usually be allocated by the storage platform.

contents.name: description
contents.comment: A description of this item

contents.name: name
contents.comment: The name of this item.

contents.name: negativeR12
contents.comment: Negative sequence series resistance from terminal sequence  1 to terminal sequence 2. Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909 EquivalentBranch is a result of network reduction prior to the data exchange Default: 0.0

contents.name: negativeR21
contents.comment: Negative sequence series resistance from terminal sequence 2 to terminal sequence 1. Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909 EquivalentBranch is a result of network reduction prior to the data exchange Default: 0.0

contents.name: negativeX12
contents.comment: Negative sequence series reactance from terminal sequence  1 to terminal sequence 2. Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909 Usage : EquivalentBranch is a result of network reduction prior to the data exchange Default: 0.0

contents.name: negativeX21
contents.comment: Negative sequence series reactance from terminal sequence 2 to terminal sequence 1. Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909. Usage: EquivalentBranch is a result of network reduction prior to the data exchange Default: 0.0

contents.name: positiveR12
contents.comment: Positive sequence series resistance from terminal sequence  1 to terminal sequence 2 . Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909.  EquivalentBranch is a result of network reduction prior to the data exchange. Default: 0.0

contents.name: positiveR21
contents.comment: Positive sequence series resistance from terminal sequence 2 to terminal sequence 1. Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909 EquivalentBranch is a result of network reduction prior to the data exchange Default: 0.0

contents.name: positiveX12
contents.comment: Positive sequence series reactance from terminal sequence  1 to terminal sequence 2. Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909 Usage : EquivalentBranch is a result of network reduction prior to the data exchange Default: 0.0

contents.name: positiveX21
contents.comment: Positive sequence series reactance from terminal sequence 2 to terminal sequence 1. Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909 Usage : EquivalentBranch is a result of network reduction prior to the data exchange Default: 0.0

contents.name: r
contents.comment: Positive sequence series resistance of the reduced branch. Default: 0.0

contents.name: r21
contents.comment: Resistance from terminal sequence 2 to terminal sequence 1 .Used for steady state power flow. This attribute is optional and represent unbalanced network such as off-nominal phase shifter. If only EquivalentBranch.r is given, then EquivalentBranch.r21 is assumed equal to EquivalentBranch.r. Usage rule : EquivalentBranch is a result of network reduction prior to the data exchange. Default: 0.0

contents.name: source
contents.comment: A sequence of characters giving the original source of the entity data as a URL. Recommended to be the fully qualified domain name of the source provider, or the URL to the source object.

contents.name: x
contents.comment: Positive sequence series reactance of the reduced branch. Default: 0.0

contents.name: x21
contents.comment: Reactance from terminal sequence 2 to terminal sequence 1 .Used for steady state power flow. This attribute is optional and represent unbalanced network such as off-nominal phase shifter. If only EquivalentBranch.x is given, then EquivalentBranch.x21 is assumed equal to EquivalentBranch.x. Usage rule : EquivalentBranch is a result of network reduction prior to the data exchange. Default: 0.0

contents.name: zeroR12
contents.comment: Zero sequence series resistance from terminal sequence  1 to terminal sequence 2. Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909 EquivalentBranch is a result of network reduction prior to the data exchange Default: 0.0

contents.name: zeroR21
contents.comment: Zero sequence series resistance from terminal sequence  2 to terminal sequence 1. Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909 Usage : EquivalentBranch is a result of network reduction prior to the data exchange Default: 0.0

contents.name: zeroX12
contents.comment: Zero sequence series reactance from terminal sequence  1 to terminal sequence 2. Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909 Usage : EquivalentBranch is a result of network reduction prior to the data exchange Default: 0.0

contents.name: zeroX21
contents.comment: Zero sequence series reactance from terminal sequence 2 to terminal sequence 1. Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909 Usage : EquivalentBranch is a result of network reduction prior to the data exchange Default: 0.0

contents.name: owner
contents.comment: A List containing a JSON encoded sequence of characters referencing the unique Ids of the owner(s)

contents.name: address
contents.comment: The mailing address
